title: Creating a Ruby on Rails 5 API
To create a new Rails 5 API, open a terminal and run the following command:

inline_content.Text: To create a new Rails 5 API, open a terminal and run the following command:

title: The following file structure will be created:

inline_content.Text: The following file structure will be created:

title:
create

create  Rakefile

create  .gitignore

title: This file structure will be created inside a new folder called
app_name
c
. It contains all the assets and code needed to start your project.

inline_content.Text: This file structure will be created inside a new folder called
. It contains all the assets and code needed to start your project.

title: Enter the folder and install the dependencies:

inline_content.Text: Enter the folder and install the dependencies:

title: You should also start your database. Rails uses SQLite as a default database. To create it, run:

inline_content.Text: You should also start your database. Rails uses SQLite as a default database. To create it, run:

title: When you open your browser at
http://localhost:3000
c
, your shiny new (empty) API should be running!
